content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Pretty straightforward and easy to solve

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple but relevant math puzzle that can be solved quickly.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and easy to solve puzzle

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle, fun and easy to solve
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

hey great puzzle if you were to open this up i'd approve it.

For the names of the test cases if you're still looking:
    You could have the first as simply "Example".
    And the second as "Almost there".

As for the title you could maybe do something like "New level up Algorithm"
Generally looks good, the only thing I would do is rephrase the formula such that L is the current level not the level to be achieved. That would be more intuitive imo.

Really nice, helps introduce you to the math aspect. As a Java user, I had to use sliiiightly different math, since ^ doesn't work, but overall, that's my problem, and easy to solve.

It's fun.

There are two clashes and one puzzle on the same theme:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/116649936be726419179648888df776150639
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/7424e168d11ce1e6714c3bf5061cbd98c128
https://www.codingame.com/training/medium/the-experience-for-creating-puzzles

However, your clash should still be acceptable as it isn't too similar to the above contributions.

Below are my comments:

Goal
* I suggest to delete the first paragraph because it doesn't provide any information relevant when writing the solution code. The statement for a clash of code should be as concise as possible. (Of course, the second paragraph will then have to be adjusted a bit.)

* I suggest to move the formula to a line on its own for clarity.

* Similarly for the example.

* The formula used by CodinGame rounds *down* the XP required, instead of rounds *to the nearest* integer. Please correct the description, your solution code and the cases.

* Suggest to emphasise that the formula gives the total amount of XP required to collect, instead of the additional amount of XP for each level-up.

Cases
* Make sure there are edge cases where using a simple rounding and a rounding-down makes a difference in the output.

* Make sure there are edge cases where the the XP collected is exactly the amount given by the formula (both (a) exact, as for levels 4, 9, 16, 25, etc., and (b) rounded down, as for other levels).

Thanks.

Thanks for your feedback! I changed the following things:

- I changed the first paragraph to something shorter. If this is still too long I can also cut it entirely.

- I tried to improve the formatting of the formulas according to your suggestions

- I changed the description and the test cases to round down instead. Correct me if I'm wrong, but it seems like the official codingame example (3^1.5*10 = 52xp) actually rounds up, but I can confirm that the actual algorithm rounds down.

- "the formula gives the total amount of XP required to collect, instead of the additional amount of XP for each level-up" -- I think I don't quite understand what you mean.  As far as I understand, the formula ((level ^ 1.5) * 10) gives the amount of additional XP needed to level up one level, not the total amount of XP required to reach that level. For example, I'm currently level 21, so I need floor((22^1.5) * 10) = 1031 XP, this is also what codingame shows me.

- I think the existing test cases already cover rounding down (e.g. the first IDE test and validator)

- The existing LEVEL UP test case already covered exact levelling up with rounding down, but I also added another LEVEL UP test case that would also pass with normal rounding

Also, is there a way to see already accepted contributions to check for similar ones? (i.e. how did you know that two similar clash of code puzzles already exist?)

Thanks.

Thanks for your feedback.

I intentionally did it this way so that it isn't just a paste-the-formula but requires at least some reading and thinking. Also this is the official formula provided by Codingame.

Let me know what you think.

Thanks, I like your names for the test cases.
For the title of the puzzle, I think I like the current title more, but thanks for your suggestion.
Oh, and I also changed the name of the first two test cases to "Basic" and "Advanced". I don't know if that is too generic, but it seems better than the old names.

Thank you for following up!

* First paragraph: The length is better now! You may keep the paragraph.

* Rounding method: I didn't even notice that the official example was wrong lol. A few actual examples:

https://www.codingame.com/profile/895997caf752533f52cd1d1430ca4bf87119362 : Level 2->3 requires 51 XP (51.96 rounded down).

https://www.codingame.com/profile/ef56a81b17871f5fbd36c711bd2314552908126 : Level 17->18 requires 763 XP (763.68 rounded down).

https://www.codingame.com/profile/bbb8f47ea4601179303c20acdbf5fb6c1904782 : Level 49->50 requires 3,535 XP (3,535.53 rounded down).

* You got me there - I'm sorry for the confusion! I was trying to say the opposite, i.e. additional XP instead of accumulated XP, but somehow I typed it the other way round, oops…

-----

To search existing (approved) contributions:

The official way is to search the titles here:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/community
(Change the filter from "Pending" to "Accepted" first. Some users said they couldn’t find that menu, so it seems that you’ve got to reach a certain condition before you gain access.)

Please refer to the screenshot below for the filter:
https://imgur.com/6XRK5vc

Another way is to use the unofficial tool made by a fellow CodinGame player:
https://codingame.tools/

The third way is to write your own code to read and search CG's clash database.

Hope this helps you! Feel free to ask again if you have any questions.

Okay, I added the word "additional" to the example to hopefully make this more clear.

It seems like my level isn't high enough yet to see that filter, but the website you sent works fine. Thanks.
